All apples are mangoes.
All mangoes are lemons.
All lemons are kiwis.
Conclusions :

(II) All mangoes are kiwis.
option_1: Neither conclusion I nor II follow.
option_4: Both conclusions I and II follow.

question:
30 is related to 216 by certain logic. Following the same logic, 40 is related to 226. To which of the following is 50 related, following the same logic?
(NOTE : Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 – Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)

Select the option that is related to the third word in the same way as the second word is related to the first word. (The words must be considered as meaningful English words and must not be related to each other based on the number of letters/number of consonants/vowels in the word.)
Pig : Piglets :: Deer : ?
solution: (c) As ‘Piglets’ are ‘baby pigs' similarly ‘Fawn’ are the ‘baby deer’.

question:
Three of the following four options are alike in a certain way and thus form a group. Which is the one that does NOT belong to that group ?
(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 – Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is nor allowed.)
solution:
(d) Logic:- equal difference between numbers.
(82 - 46 - 10) :- (82-46) = 36 and 46 - 10 = 36
(90 - 99 - 108) :- (99-90) = 9 and 108 - 99 = 9
(67 - 45 - 23) :- (67-45) = 22 and 45 - 23 = 22
But
(90 - 51 - 13) :- (90-51) = 39 and 51 - 13 = 38

question: In a certain code language, 'sun and sand' is written as 'zf jc dt', and 'the hot sun' is coded as 'km dt wo'. How will 'sun' be coded in that language?
solution:
(c) sun and sand → zf jc dt……… (i)
the hot sun → km dt wo…….. (ii)
From (i) and (ii) ‘sun’ and ‘dt’ are common. The code of ‘sun’ = ‘dt’.

question:
What will come in the place of the question mark (?) in the following equation, if ‘+' and '÷’ are interchanged and ‘-’ and '×' are interchanged ?
44 ÷ 78 + 6 - 3 × 19 = ?
solution:
(b) Given :- 44 ÷ 78 + 6 - 3 × 19
As per given instruction after interchanging ‘+’ and ‘÷’ and ‘-’ and ‘×’ we get
44 + 78 ÷ 6 × 3 - 19
44 + 13 × 3 - 19
44 + 39 - 19
44 + 20 = 64

question:
What will come in place of the question mark (?) in the following equation if ‘+’ means ‘×’, ‘−’ means ‘÷’, ‘×’ means ‘+’ and ‘÷’ means ‘−’ ?
(18 + 10 × 20) − 8 ÷ 6 = ?
solution:
(a) Given :- (18 + 10 × 20) - 8 ÷ 6
As per given instruction after interchanging the sign we get,
(18 × 10 + 20) ÷ 8 - 6
(180 + 20) ÷ 8 - 6
(25) - 6 = 19

question: How many states are covered in the World Bank report titled ‘Jobs at Your Doorstep : A Jobs Diagnostics for Young People’?
solution: (c) 6. The World Bank’s report titled ‘Jobs at Your Doorstep: A Jobs Diagnostics for Young People’ covers six states: Himachal Pradesh, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Odisha, and Rajasthan. Union Minister for Education, Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, along with Minister of Labour and Employment and Youth Affairs and Sports Dr. Mansukh Mandaviya launched this report in New Delhi.

question: Which team won the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) 2024 ?
solution: (b) Mumbai. Mumbai defeated Madhya Pradesh by five wickets to win the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy 2024.

question: The 10th International Forest Fair took place in _________, Madhya Pradesh.
solution: (d) Bhopal. This festival started on December 17, 2024, and concluded on December 23. The fair aims to promote sustainable forest practices, empower local communities, and encourage collaboration among stakeholders in the forestry sector.

question: In which of the following festivals is Kolam drawn ?
solution: (d) Pongal. It is a harvest festival celebrated by the Tamil community. It is primarily celebrated in Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and Puducherry. Other harvesting festivals: Karma (Jharkhand), Bhogali Bihu (Assam), Hareli (Chhattisgarh), Onam (Kerala), Nuakhai (Odisha), Gudi Padwa (Maharashtra).

question: From which of the following epics did the Garadi folk dance of Puducherry originate ?
solution: (a) Ramayana. Garadi dance is mainly performed at the time of the car festival of Lord Vishnu. Indian States and folk Dances: Kerala - Chavittukali, Kolkali or Kolkkali, Kummattikkali. Goa - Dashavatara, Dekhni, Dhalo, Dhangar, Fugdi, Ghodemodni. Karnataka - Dollu Kunitha, Bayalata, Kamsale, Veeragase. Maharashtra - Dhangari Gaja, Lavani, Povada, and Koli dance.

question: Who among the following is a distinguished and experienced scion of the famous Kavungal family associated with 'Kathakali' for six generations ?
solution: (c) Chathunni Panicker: Awards - Padma Shri (2006), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1973). Other exponents of Kathakali - Kanak Rele, Kottakkal Sivaraman, Guru Kunchu Kurup. Padma Subramanyam (Bharatanatyam): Awards - Padma Vibhushan (2024), Padma Bhushan (2003), Padma shri (1981). Guru Ammannur Madhava Chakyar (Kutiyattam): Award - Padma shri (1982).

question: Who among the following wrote the book ‘Chanakya’s Chant’ ?
solution: (d) Ashwin Sanghi. His other books: ‘The Rozabal Line’, ‘The Krishna Key’, ‘The Sialkot Saga’. Novoneel Chakraborty - ‘Stranger Trilogy’, ‘Forever is True’, ‘Half Torn Hearts’. Samit Basu - ‘The Simoqin Prophecies’, ‘The City Inside’, ‘Chosen Spirits’. Amish Tripathi - ‘The Immortals of Meluha’, ‘The Secret of the Nagas’, ‘The Shiva Trilogy’.

question: ______ was the first fast bowler who was the Indian test team captain.
solution: (d) Kapil Dev. He is the only player in the history of cricket to have taken more than 400 wickets (434 wickets) and scored more than 5,000 runs in Test. He captained the Indian cricket team that won the 1983 Cricket World Cup, and in the process became the first Indian captain to win the Cricket World Cup.

question:
While estimating Gross Domestic Product, the monetary value of only final goods are considered because ___________.
a. its immobility, the active economic flow is ended.
b. of the issues of double counting
c. the value added at each stage of the production process is included
solution: (a) Only b. Gross Domestic Product (GDP) - Aggregate value of goods and services produced within the domestic territory of a country. While estimating GDP, the monetary value of only final goods is considered to avoid the problem of double counting. If intermediate goods were included, they would be counted multiple times, leading to an inflated GDP figure.

question: The institute established by Kaka Hathrasi in 1932 is:
solution: (a) Sangeet Karyalaya: Located - Hathras (Uttar Pradesh). The institute was founded with the aim of promoting Indian classical music and preserving the cultural heritage of India. Kaka Hathrasi published the monthly magazine "SANGEET" in 1935.

question: Which language is known as ‘Italian of the East’ ?
solution: (a) Telugu. Telugu Language Day is celebrated every year on August 29. In 2008, Telugu was granted the status of a classical language. Nicolo di Conti, who visited the Vijayanagara Empire, found that the words in the Telugu language end with vowels, just like those in Italian, and hence referred to it as "The Italian of the East”.

question: The ______ were tributary chiefs of the Gupta dynasty. They established an independent kingdom in western India. Dhruvasena II was the most important ruler of this kingdom.
solution: (a) Maitrakas established Valabhi as their capital and ruled until the middle of the eighth century. Dhruvasena II was a contemporary of Harshavardhana and was married to his daughter. Hsuan Tsang tells us that Dhruvasena II attended Harsha’s assembly at Prayaga (Allahabad). Maukharies ruled over Kanauj, a city in western Uttar Pradesh, they were also the subordinate rulers of the Guptas and used the title of samanta.

question: Which of the following types of emergencies is declared under Article 360 of the Indian Constitution ?
solution: (b) Financial Emergency. Article 360 in Part XVIII of the Indian Constitution empowers the President of India to proclaim a Financial Emergency if he/she is satisfied that a situation has arisen due to which the financial stability or credit of India or any part of its territory is threatened. Other Emergency types: National Emergency (Article 352): Declared during war, external aggression, or armed rebellion. State Emergency/President's Rule (Article 356): When state machinery fails or state government cannot be carried on according to the Constitution.

question: In which year was the Gandhi-Irwin Pact signed ?
solution: (c) 1931. The Gandhi-Irwin Pact was signed on March 5, 1931, between Mahatma Gandhi and Lord Irwin, the Viceroy of India (1926-1931). The pact ended the Civil Disobedience Movement, initiated by Gandhi with the Salt March, and was signed before the Second Round Table Conference in London.

question: Who among the following deciphered the Brahmi Script of the Mauryan period ?
solution: (b) James Prinsep deciphered the Brahmi and Kharoshthi scripts. The Brahmi script, one of the oldest writing styles in ancient India, is best exemplified by the rock-cut edicts of Ashoka, which were deciphered by Prinsep, an archaeologist with the East India Company.

question: The digestive enzymes inside lysosomes are made by:
solution: (a) rough endoplasmic reticulum. Digestive enzymes are proteins that break down food so our body can absorb nutrients. Plastids are double membrane bound organelles found in the cytoplasm of plant cells and some protists such as Euglena. Golgi apparatus is a central membrane organelle for trafficking and post-translational modification of protein and lipid in the cell. Mitochondria are the "powerhouses" of the cell, breaking down fuel molecules and capturing energy in cellular respiration.

question: Kaal Baisakhi belongs to which state from the following ?
solution: (c) West Bengal. Kal Baisakhi, also known as Nor'westers, is a pre-monsoon thunderstorm characteristic of West Bengal, typically occurring in the Bengali month of Baisakh (April-May). Related meteorological terms: Cherry Blossoms/Coffee Showers - It is the local humid wind of Karnataka that is helpful for the coffee plantation and flows in the hot weather season. Mango- shower - It is pre-monsoon rainfall and occurs especially in parts of Kerala, and Karnataka. It helps in the early ripening of mangoes.

question: The zone where the earthquake waves are not observed is called:
solution: (c) Shadow Zone. The shadow zone is the area between 104 to 140 degrees from an earthquake where no direct P waves are received. It occurs because S waves are stopped by the liquid core, and P waves are refracted. The benthic zone is the lowest ecological region of a body of water, such as a lake or ocean. The hypocenter is the point inside the Earth where an earthquake begins, while the epicenter is the point on the surface directly above it.

question: Which of following is NOT a device of parliamentary proceedings ?
solution: (d) Full-day discussion. Devices of Parliamentary Proceedings refers to the various procedural tools, mechanisms, and practices employed within a parliamentary system to facilitate the conduct of the business of the legislature. Half-an-Hour Discussion - It is meant for discussing a matter of sufficient public importance, which has been subjected to a lot of debate and the answer to which needs elucidation on a matter of fact. Zero-Hour Discussion - This occurs immediately after Question Hour, allowing members to raise urgent matters without prior notice. Short Duration Discussion - It is also known as two-hour discussion as the time allotted for such a discussion should not exceed two hours.

question: Air and National Defence are examples of which of the following goods ?
solution: (a) Public goods are resources that are available to everyone, and can be used without reducing their availability to others. Public goods are characterized by non-excludability (no one can be excluded from using them) and non-rivalry (one person's use does not reduce availability to others). Air (as a clean resource) and National Defence are examples of public goods because they are available for everyone to use, and their consumption by one individual does not diminish their availability to others.

question: Which Law of Newton states that for every action (force) in nature there is an equal and opposite reaction ?
solution: (d) 3rd. Newton's first law states that every object will remain at rest or in uniform motion in a straight line unless compelled to change its state by the action of an external force. Newton's second law of motion states that F = ma, or net force is equal to mass times acceleration.

question: What is the chemical formula for sodium bicarbonate ?
solution: (c) NaHCO3. Sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO3), or baking soda, is used in baking, cleaning, and as an antacid. It reacts with acids to release carbon dioxide, helping dough rise. Sodium chloride (NaCl) is common table salt, while sodium carbonate (Na2CO3) is soda ash, and sodium hydroxide (NaOH) is a strong base known as caustic soda.

question: The iodine value of oil and fat indicates:
solution: (a) degree of unsaturation. Iodine value or number is the number of grams of iodine consumed by 100g of fat. A higher iodine value indicates a higher degree of unsaturation.

question: Identify the device used to change the resistance in an electric circuit.
solution: (b) Rheostat. Ammeter is a device used to measure either alternating or direct current. Conductors are those substances through which electricity can flow are called conductors. Insulators are those substances through which electricity cannot flow easily. The voltmeter is a measurement device used to measure voltage in electrical circuits or electronic devices.

question: What is the chemical reaction that occurs when sugar is heated and turns into a caramel syrup?
solution: (c) Caramelisation. Maillard Reaction: A chemical reaction between amino acids and reducing sugars. It occurs during cooking, responsible for browning of food and creating complex flavors. Precipitation is any liquid or frozen water that forms in the atmosphere and falls back to the earth. It comes in many forms, like rain, sleet, and snow. A neutralization reaction is when an acid and a base react to form water and a salt.

question: A class of 30 students appeared in a test. The average score of 12 students is 62, and that of the rest is 74. What is the average score of the class ?
solution:
(b)
No of students 12 : 18 = 2 : 3
Average score 62 62+12
Average score of the class = 62 + 12×32+3 = 62 + 7.2 = 69.2

question: If tan4θ. tan6θ = 1, where 6θ is an acute angle, then find the value of Cot5θ.
solution:
(d) Given:- tan 4θ. tan6θ = 1
⇒ tan 4θ = 1tan6θ
⇒ tan 4θ = cot 6θ
⇒ tan 4θ = tan(90° - 6θ)
⇒ 4θ = 90° - 6θ
⇒ 10θ = 90°
⇒ θ = 9°
Put the value of θ in Cot5θ
cot 45° = 1

question: A seller decreased the selling price of each item from ₹5,000 to ₹4,680, by which his loss percentage increased by 4%. If he has to get 4% profit, then the selling price of the item should be:
solution:
(b) According to the question,
(CP-5000CP) × 100 + 4 = (CP-4680CP) × 100
100CP-500000+4CPCP = 100CP-468000CP
100CP - 500000 + 4CP = 100 CP - 468000
4CP = 32000
CP = ₹8000
Now, if he get 4% profit ,then SP = 8000 × 104100 = ₹8320
Short trick :- 4% = (5000 - 4680) = ₹320
100% = ₹8000
Then, required SP = 8000 × 104100 = ₹8320

question: A’s income is equal to 125% of the income of B, while B’s savings are 120% of the savings of A. If the expenditure of B is 75% of the expenditure of A, then how much are B’s savings as a percentage of her expenditure?
solution:
(a) Ratio - A : B
Expendi. - 100y : 75y
Savings - 100x : 120x
-------------------------------
Income - 5 : 4
100x+100y120x+75y = 54
400x + 400y = 600x + 375y
25y = 200x
xy = 25200 = 18
B’s savings = 120x = 120 × 1 = 120
B’s expenditure = 75y = 75 × 8 = 600
Required % = 120600 × 100 = 20%

question: Which of the following numbers will completely divide 412 + 413 + 414 + 415 ?
solution:
(a) 412 + 413 + 414 + 415
⇒ 412 ( 1 + 41 + 42 + 43 )
⇒ 412 ( 1 + 4 + 16 + 64)
⇒ 412 (85)
85 is divisible by 17 and hence 17 is the answer.

question:
The monthly wages (in ₹) of three mess workers, Rahul, Sunil and Vipin, of a boy’s hostel for three months are given in the following table. Study the table carefully and answer the question given below.

In November, the wages of Sunil is what percentage of the wages of Rahul ? (Correct up to two decimal places.)


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1743495627714.png
solution:
(d)
Required % = 1050011500 × 100 = 91.30%

question: The value of 29 - [(48 ÷ 12) + 2 × (8 ÷ 4 + 4)] is equal to:
The average of the squares of the first 46 natural numbers is
solution:
(b)
Sum of square of n natural numbers = n(n+1)(2n+1)6
Sum of square of 46 natural numbers = 46(46+1)(2×46+1)6
= 46×47×936 = 33511
Required average = 3351146 = 728.5

question: A drink is made by mixing water and juice in the ratio 9 : 7. If x litres of water and 2x litres of juice are mixed in 160 litres of drink, then the new ratio becomes 13 : 15. The quantity of drink (in litres) is:
solution:
(b)
Mixture → Water : Juice
160 liter → 90 lit. : 70 lit.
↓+x lit. : ↓+2x lit.
Final → 13 : 15
90+x70+2x = 1315
1350 + 15x = 910 + 26x
11x = 440
x = 40
Water + juice added = x + 2x = 40 + 80 = 120 litres
Total quantity of drink = 160 + 120 = 280 litres

question: if 7 tanθ = 3, and θ is an acute angle , then 5sinθ-cosθ5sinθ+2cosθ is equal to :
solution:
(a)
7tan θ = 3 ⇒ tanθ = 37
Now,
5sinθ-cosθ5sinθ+2cosθ = 5tanθ-15tanθ+2 = 5×37-15×37+2 = 87297 = 829

question: A solid metallic cylinder of base radius 6 cm and height 10 cm is melted to form small cylinders, each of height 2.5 cm and base radius 2 cm. Find the number of small cylinders.
solution:
(a) Let the number of small cylinder = n
Volume of the cylinder = πr2h
Volume of bigger cylinder = n × volume of small cylinder
6 × 6 × 10 = n × 2 × 2 × 2.5
n = 36

question:
Find the value of the following expression.
1+sinθ1-sinθ
solution:
(a)
1+sinθ1-sinθ
= 1+sinθ1-sinθ×1+sinθ1-sinθ = 1+sinθ21-sin2θ
= 1+sinθcosθ = secθ + tanθ

question: If m = a secA and y = b tan A then find the value of b2m2 - a2y2 + a2y2b2m2 + cos2A.
solution:
(d) Given: m = a secA and y = b tan A
b2m2 - a2y2 + a2y2b2m2 + cos2A
= b2a2sec2A - a2b2tan2A + a2b2tan2Ab2a2sec2A + cos2 A
= a2b2 (sec2A - tan2A ) + tan2Asec2A + cos2A
= a2b2(1) + Sin2A×cos2Acos2A + cos2A
= a2b2 + 1

question: A car covers the distance from Delhi to Gurugram at 60 km/h and returns at a uniform speed of 40 km/h. The average speed of the car during the whole journey is:
solution:
(d) Let the distance be 120 km i.e. LCM of (60, 40)
average speed = 120×212060+12040 = 2402+3 = 2405 = 48 km/hr

question: The radius of a roller is 49 cm and its length is 200 cm. It takes 700 complete revolutions to move once over to level a playground. Find the area of the playground (Use π = 227.)
solution:
(a) Area of the playground = 700 × CSA of cylinder
= 700 × 2πrh
= 700 × 2 × 227 × 49 × 200
= 4312 × 104 cm²

question: If p = 106, q = 105 and r = 104, then value of p² + q² + r² - pq - qr - rp is:
solution:
(d) Formula used : a2 + b2 + c2 - ab - bc - ca = 12[(a - b)2 + (b - c)2 + (c - a)2]
Then, p² + q² + r² - pq - qr - rp = 12(106-105)2+(105-104)2+(106-104)2
= 1212+12+22 = 12 × 6 = 3

question: Pradeep sells two fans at ₹480 each and by doing so he gains 20% on one fan and loses 20% on the other. His loss on the whole (in ₹) is:
In what ratio must a grocer mix two varieties of pulses costing ₹60 and ₹75 per kg, respectively, so as to get a mixture worth ₹65 per kg ?
solution:
(b)

Required ratio = 2 : 1

question: 30 men working 5 hours a day can do work in 18 days. In how many days will 20 men working 7 hours a day do the same work ?
solution:
(a)
M1D1H1 = M2D2H2
30 × 18 × 5 = 20 × D2 × 7
D2 = 30×18×520×7 = 1357 = 1927 Days

question: The marked price of an item is 1.4 times the cost price. In order to earn 23.2% profit, what percent discount can a shopkeeper allow ?
solution:
(d)
MPCP = 100+P%100-D%
1410 = 100+23.2100-D%
100 - D% = 57 × 123.2
100 - D% = 88
D% = 12%

question: Ramu used to spend 72% of his income. His income has increased by 12%, and he increases his expenditure by 5%. If Ramu earlier saved y and after the increases he now saves x, then what is the value of (x-yy × 100)% ?
solution:
(d) Let the income of the Ramu is 100 units
According to the question,
Ratio - before : after
Income - 100 : 112
Expenditure - 72 : 75.6
Saving - 28 : 36.4
Required value = (x-yy × 100)% = (36.4-2828 × 100)% = 30%

question: What will be the amount due on ₹12,000 in 2 years when the rate of simple interest on successive years is 9% and 10%, respectively ?
solution:
(d)
Amount due = 12000 × 119100 = ₹14,280

question: A man bought 4 books for ₹50 each, 5 books for ₹60 each and 6 books for ₹70 each. The average cost of a book for the man is (round up to two decimal places):
solution:
(a)
Cost of 4 books = 4 × 50 = 200
Cost of 5 books = 5 × 60 = 300
Cost of 6 books = 6 × 70 = 420
Average cost = 200+300+4204+5+6 = 61.33

question:
The given chart shows the production of different types of cars in the year 2021.
Study the given chart and answer the question that follows.

If the total production in the year 2021 was 2,00,00,000, then what will be the central angle of the sector representing the production of type D cars in 2021?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1743495628297.png
solution:
(d) As we know, 1% = 3.6°
Then, Production of type D cars in 2021 = 20% = 20 × 3.6° = 72°

question: On a 200-m-long circular track, two people start from the same point, at the same time, at speeds of 12 km/h and 15 km/h, respectively. After how much time will they meet again for the first time if they are running in the same direction ?
solution: (c) Time taken to meet again for the first time = 2003×518 = 200×65 = 240sec

question:
Parts of the following sentence have been given as options. Select the option that contains an error.
Solutions to the country’s interior problems are still a long way away.
solution:
(d) the country’s interior
The correct word to use in this sentence is ‘internal’, not ‘interior’. ‘Internal’ means occurring inside a country. Hence, the country’s internal is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the idiom ( in the context).
A man of straw
solution:
(a) A man of no substance
Eg- As he is a man of straw people do not trust him easily.

question:
Identify the segment in the sentence which contains grammatical error. Mark ‘no error’ in case the sentence given is correct.
No sooner the teacher entered the class than the students stopped talking.
solution:
(a) entered the class.
“No sooner + Verb + Subject” is the correct grammatical structure for the given sentence. Hence, ‘No sooner had(Verb) the teacher(Subject)’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.
Though Mr. Swami ran in debt, he did not stop wasting money.
solution: (b) To 'run into' means to experience a difficult situation or a problem. In the given question Mr Swami ran into a debt

question:
Choose the most appropriate option to change the narration (direct/indirect) of the given sentence:
The manager said, “Well, what can I do for you ?”
option_1: The manager wanted to know what he could do for him.
option_2: The manager wanted to know that what he could do for him.
option_3: The manager asked what he can do for him.
option_4: The manager wanted to know what he can do for him.
solution:
(a) The manager wanted to know what he could do for him.
(b) The manager wanted to know that what he could do for him. (Incorrect connecting word)
(c) The manager asked that what he can do for him. (Incorrect connecting word)
(d) The manager wanted to know what he can do for him. (Incorrect change of tense)

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
I remember my mother taking me to the stadium.
option_1: I remember being taken to the stadium by my mother.
option_2: I was taken to the stadium by mother that I remembered.
option_3: My mother remembered me taken to the stadium.
option_4: I was remembered being taken to the stadium by my mother.
solution:
(a) I remember being taken to the stadium by my mother. (Correct)
(b) I was taken to the stadium by mother that I remembered. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)
(c) My mother remembered me taken to the stadium. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)
(d) I was remembered being taken to the stadium by my mother. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)

question:
Find a word that is the synonym of
Renounce
solution:
(d) Abjure.
Renounce means to give up something. Abjure means to give up a belief, claim etc. So option ‘d’ abjure is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
(A) So Golu set out for the river Limpopo.
(B) One day Golu met the mynah bird sitting in the middle of a bush.
(C) He asked her, “What does the crocodile have for dinner?
(D) The mynah said, “Go to the banks of the great, grassy Limpopo river and find out.
solution:
(b) BCDA
Sentence B will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. Once Golu met the Mynah bird. Sentence C states the conversation between them i.e. He asked her what the crocodile has for dinner . So, C will follow B. Further, Sentence D states what the bird replied to him. It told him to go to the bank of the Limpopo river and Sentence A states that he went there . So, A will follow D. Going through the options, option (b) has the correct sequence.

question:
Pick a word opposite in meaning to
Frivolous
solution:
(d) Serious.
Frivolous means not having any serious purpose or value. So option d serious is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(b) chancellary
‘Chancellery’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the word which means the same as the group of words given.
That which cannot be defeated
solution:
(a) Invincible,
Invincible - Too powerful to be defeated or overcome.
Invulnerable - Impossible to harm or damage.
Infallible - Incapable of making mistakes or being wrong.
Indictable - an indictable crime is one that someone can be accused of in a court of law.

question:
Identify the best way to improve the underlined part of the given sentence. If there is no improvement required, select ‘no improvement’.
Heartfelt prayers to God will always have expected results.
solution:
(a) Have desired results
“Desired results” are those which the person praying wishes for.

question:
Choose the best alternative which best expresses the meaning of the idiom/ phrase given below.
Your remarks during the discussion added fuel to the fire.
solution:
(c) worsened matters.
Example- The CBI chief said he wouldn't add fuel to the fire by letting out the report before the Press.

question:
Select the word which means the same as the group of words given.
A new word.
solution:
(a) neologism
Neologism - A newly coined word
Niche - A niche is a place or position that's particularly appropriate for someone or something, especially due to being very specific and different from others.
Nausea - Vomiting tendency
Nephrology - The study of normal kidney function and related diseases.

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
(A) Goats in hilly regions hate being tied to trees or poles
(B) Poor Abbu Khan was a little unlucky in the matter of his goats.
(C) Very often at night one of the goats would pull and pull at the string till it broke loose.
(D) Then it would disappear into the hills beyond.
solution:
(d) BCDA
Sentence B will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e.Poor Abbu Khan was unlucky in the matter of goats. . Sentence C states the incident that one night one goat tried to break its string . So, C will follow B . Further, Sentence D states that after the string had broken, it went to the hills and Sentence A states that in the hills, goats don’t like to be tied . So A will follow D. Going through the options, option (d) BCDA has the correct sequence.

question:
Find a word that is the synonym of the given word in the sentance .
His strategy is to protract negotiations until the enemy are exhausted while assembling the forces necessary to crush them.
solution:
(b) Prolong- to make something last longer
Protract- to make something last for a long time
Control- power and ability to make somebody/something do what you want
Accept- to agree to take something that somebody offers you
Cease- to stop or end

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
In the Second World War, the British _____ thousands of so-called interceptors – mostly women – whose job it was to tune in every day and night to the radio _____ of the various divisions of the German military.
solution:
(c) assembled, broadcasts
Broadcast is a verb it means to transmit (a programme or some information) by radio or television. And broadcast is available only in option c. Also when people get together at a certain place the verb used is assemble. Hence option (c) is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Pick a word opposite in the meaning to
Efficacious
solution:
(b) Efficacious (Adjective) .It means productive, effective; producing the result. Ineffective .It means not achieving what you want to achieve.
Look at the sentence: They hope the new drug will prove especially efficacious in the relief of pain. The law proved ineffective in dealing with the problem.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.
The first thing they did was to _____ the extent of damage done by the rains.
solution:
(b) Ascertain - Make sure of
Circulate - pass from one person to another, spread
Repair - Restore to a good condition
Search - To look for something

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
The flight is carrying relief material.
option_1: Relief material is being carrying by the flight.
option_2: Relief material is being carried by the flight.
option_3: Relief material is carried by the flight.
option_4: Relief material is carrying by the flight.
solution:
(b) Relief material is being carried by the flight. (Correct)
(a) Relief material is being carrying by the flight. (Incorrect form of Verb )
(c) Relief material is carried by the flight. (‘Being’ is missing)
(d) Relief material is carrying by the flight. (Incorrect verb)

question:
Cloze Test :
Everything (96) _____ us makes our environment. Living and non-living things form the (97) _____ of our surroundings. Plants, animals and microbes are parts of our environment. Plants, animals and microbes have affected the environment in multiple (98) ______ like clearing of forests, building houses and farms, making roads, etc. This is the root (99) _____ of air, water and land pollution on the planet. Ecologists across the globe are making efforts to educate mankind about the (100) _____ of nature, the crisis we face and the methods of managing these crises.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank No. 96.
solution: (d) Around means situated on every side. So everything situated on every side makes our environment.

question:
Cloze Test :
Everything (96) _____ us makes our environment. Living and non-living things form the (97) _____ of our surroundings. Plants, animals and microbes are parts of our environment. Plants, animals and microbes have affected the environment in multiple (98) ______ like clearing of forests, building houses and farms, making roads, etc. This is the root (99) _____ of air, water and land pollution on the planet. Ecologists across the globe are making efforts to educate mankind about the (100) _____ of nature, the crisis we face and the methods of managing these crises.

solution: (c) Components means something which is part of a larger whole.

question:

Ecologists across the globe are making efforts to educate mankind about the (100) _____ of nature, the crisis we face and the methods of managing these crises.

solution: (d) Humans have affected the environment in multiple “ways” like clearing of forests, building houses and farms, making roads, etc.

question:

Everything (96) _____ us makes our environment. Living and non-living things form the (97) _____ of our surroundings. Plants, animals and microbes are parts of our environment. Plants, animals and microbes have affected the environment in multiple (98) ______ like clearing of forests, building houses and farms, making roads, etc. This is the root (99) _____ of air, water and land pollution on the planet.
